newsitem.title: USA: Entergy sets security monitoring operation.
newsitem.headline: Entergy sets security monitoring operation.

text.p: Entergy Corp said Wednesday it signed a letter of intent to acquire National Security Service for undisclosed terms.
From this beginning, Entergy said, the company plans to grow its stake in the security monitoring business through customer sales and future acquisitions.
The privately-owned full-service security monitoring company with operations in North Carolina and Alabama has about $25 million in annual revenue and 40,000 customers.
The transaction is expected to be completed before year end and is subject to review by the federal regulators.

"A key element of Entergy's long-term strategy is to transform the retail element of our business into a more robust, services-based and value-adding relationship with our existing customers while at the same time aggressively growing the absolute number of customers we serve through geographic and service business expansion," said John A. Brayman, executive vice president - Business Development.
"Our planned acquisition of NSS is an early step in the execution of this long-term strategy."
